commit_message:
+ fix variable in the HaplotypeCaller command

- to be consistent i should use the ${chromosome} variable everywhere the ${chr} variable was used.
-  i changed the variable name from the code snippet so that it is more clear from the reading

+ simplify gnarlygenotyper description

-  keep things as simple as possible for the moment.

    i'm not entirely clear about all the details regarding the Gnarlygenotyper

+ adjust ReblockGVCF.wdl url location

  - this is just to reflect how this repository has changed locations
    from https://github.com/indraniel to https://github.com/hall-lab
+ add in user github links
+ add in a paragraph break

+ update README

  - describe the main alterations from the original Broad WDL
  - give a short description regarding the GVCF inputs that are supplied
    as inputs to this pipeline
+ add in a LICENSE

+ add in a README

  - this is just a start of a basic README for now.

+ add an example inputs tsv file

  - this is a 2 sample chromosome 1 and 2 1000 Genome test case
+ include example input cromwell json file

+ include the tranches, metrics, and vcfs in the final output

    - the prior successful workflow didn't place the output vcf shards
      into the "final" output location.  Additionally, the tranches file
      should be noted as well.

+ account for the single CollectMetricsSharded task failure

  - we observed a failure with an error message like so:

    "Execution failed: generic::unknown: pulling image:
     docker pull: running [""docker"" ""pull"" ""us.gcr.io/broad-gatk/gatk@sha256:cc8981d0527e716775645b04a7f59e96a52ad59a7ae9788ddc47902384bf35aa""]:
     exit status 1 (standard error: ""failed to register layer: Error processing tar file(exit status 1):
     write /opt/miniconda/envs/gatk/lib/python3.6/site-packages/Bio/Sequencing/Applications/__pycache__/_Novoalign.cpython-36.pyc:
     no space left on device\n"")"

   This may have been just a transient error; but, just in case, we'll increase the allocated disk size

   The the following google genomics jobs for the gory details:

     projects/washu-genome-inh-dis-analysis/operations/4915043661782274284
Move intermediate list into a filename with .list suffix
Write inputs into intermediate list to avoid too many command line arguments

+ more GenotypeGVCFs & ImportGVCFs updates

  - increase the memory and disk size to address the current set of
    failures

  hopefully this addresses the TileDB errors and other disk issue error
  cases

+ setting preemptible to 1 for GenotypeGVCFs task

  - give it one shot on the cheaper preemptible route, otherwise take
    the more definite, but expensive compute

+ temporarily reset the preemptible tries back to 2

  - Eddie is doing an analysis on start and end times before we attempt to change the preemptible tries

+ update memory and preemptible tries for the 3rd attempt

  - increased the memory and preemptible tries for the ImportGVCFs and GenotypeGVCFs tasks.
    Hopefully this will make things more optimal based on our current quotas
GenotypeGVCFs uses 4 cpus
Slightly increase memory
Allow 2 preemptible tries for most tasks

+ enable the allow_old_rms_mapping_quality_annotation_data option

  - our inputs GVCFs are from GATK 3.5 and expect the old style mapping quality annotations

+ don't use the GnarlyGenotyper for now

  - we need to run ReblockGVCF on all of the input GVCFs first
  - gonna punt for that later, right now we want to see how the VQSR steps work on this new pipeline

+ add in the ReblockGVCF WDL

  - this was obtained via Terra (via a side email conversation with
    Laura Gauthier at the Broad Institute -- See subject "Another
    GnarlyGenotyper Question" on 2020-02-04).

    Reblocking is needed to run the GnarlyGenotyper

+ double the size of the GnarlyGenotyper disk space

  - one of the jobs ran out of disk space at its current setting
+ account for requester pays buckets

+ adjust script to submit workflow

  - account for the dependency task file
  - update the inputs and workflow wdl
+ use the correct input path
Do not scatter intervals

JG WDL

add Tasks prefix
correct final output intervals
Correct tasks WDL CheckSamplesUnique command

Tasks JGT WDL

correct inputs to collect gvcfs tasks
add disk, and use GiB

+ adjust how to count number of samples

  - use the groups recommendations

+ don't subscatter when using GnarlyGenotyper

  - we're using the unpadded intervals directly; so we don't need to
    subscatter even further.

+ remove/add SplitIntervalList and CollectGVCFs tasks

  - remove SplitIntervalList
  - add CollectGVCFs

  CollectGVCFs were taken from the older WDL
+ add in the CollectGVCFs step

+ directly use the unpadded intervals

  - avoid going through GATK SplitIntervals;  not sure how it's working
    at the moment
+ add the example input json to the new JointGenotyping WDL

+ adjust CheckSamplesUnique task

  - account for the way we shard up our gvcfs by sample and chromosome

+ introduce Tasks.ComputeNumSamples

  - this new task will calculate "num_gvcfs" or the number of samples
    involved in this call set
+ enable the GnarlyGenotyper

+ remove the fingerprinting

  - this fingerprinting check doesn't seem necessary for us

    According to Laura Gauthier at the Broad:

        An early version of GenomicsDB mixed up samples if more than one
        batch was used to import.  The fingerprinting is effectively a
        regression test against that.

+ use the local tasks

  - don't use the github reference tasks

+ starting point of the latest WDL pipeline

  - this is based upon the latest Broad workflow from January 2020
